page.title: 20CHURCHYARD BLOSSOM
page.content:
The blossom on the tree that stands Beautiful pale pink and white Against the greys of the walls, So many colours about me. Branches droop with the weight. The birds fly in and out,suddenly, Out of quietness, a chirp. The misty, gentle, breezy sky peeps, The branches form shapes and patterns The wind changes. The blossom falls, Confetti,the wedding over. Bees buzz around Nectar fuelled, pollen laden. The churchyard is a very quiet and peaceful place to be.
These pages were written by children of Sherston C.E. Primary School Class 4 with editing assistance of the staff.
